greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of prime factors of n that are less than the largest, counted with multiplicity.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
example: The prime factors of 300 are {2,2,3,5,5} of which {2,2,3} are less than the largest, so a(300) = 3.
xref: Positions of 0's are A000961. Positions of 1's are A325230. Positions of terms > 1 are A307517.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 12 2019
ext: Data section extended up to term a(105) by _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 17 2019
